snippet: Few governmental bodies have had a more troubled childhood than the board established in 2004 to make certain that more aggressive intelligence collection did not unduly infringe on Americans' rights, writes our colleague Scott Shane.
abstract: Few governmental bodies have had a more troubled childhood than the board established in 2004 to make certain that more aggressive intelligence collection did not unduly infringe on Americans' rights, writes our colleague Scott Shane.

headline.main: The Agenda: Civil Liberties Oversight Board
